definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night

sentences.english: Nana pulled an all-nighter to study for her math exam.
sentences.chinese: 为了应付数学考试，娜娜学了一个通宵。

sentences.english: Example: We had to pull an all-nighter to get the work finished on time.
sentences.chinese: 为了按时完成工作，我们要熬通宵了。

sentences.english: The young girls and boys boogied all night long.
sentences.chinese: 那些少男少女跳了个通宵的迪斯科舞。

sentences.english: She likes to stay in the coffee house which is an all-nighter.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢待在通宵经营的咖啡店里。

sentences.english: These rooms would be lighted up every evening.
sentences.chinese: 客房里的房间通宵达旦灯火通明。

sentences.english: They'll be dancing all night—we'd better just go to bed and let things rip!
sentences.chinese: 他们跳舞会跳通宵的，我们最好去睡觉，别管它。

sentences.english: industry go overdrawn overnight does no good. The market needs to grow in a healthy way.
sentences.chinese: 让一个行业通宵透支没有好处，市场需要健康地成长。

sentences.english: He often works round the clock.
sentences.chinese: 他经常通宵达旦地工作。

sentences.english: The service, called IDnight, will have music, dancing and an all-night bar.
sentences.chinese: 车上会播放音乐，可以跳舞，还设有通宵酒吧。

sentences.english: To find their own Jiemei Tao, occasionally frantic a night, what not?
sentences.chinese: 找自己的姐妹淘，偶尔疯狂一个通宵有什么不可以？

sentences.english: Don't be all night over finishing your report.
sentences.chinese: 不必熬通宵来完成你的报告。

sentences.english: Gas stations usually have an all-night attendant.
sentences.chinese: 加油站一般会通宵服务。

sentences.english: There was a non-stop TV programmer all the night on the eve of Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞前夜有一场通宵连续播放的电视节目。

sentences.english: It was either sleep here, or stay up all night at an after-hours dance club.
sentences.chinese: 我们要么睡车里要么在通宵舞厅里呆一个晚上。

definition: overnight until daybreak (idiom); all night long/day and night
to stay up late or all night
the whole night/all through the night
midnight/in the middle of the night
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to burn the midnight oil/to work late into the night
